content.description: This is the first route you get to if approaching from the south. This route involves some thought provoking airy arete moves through 4 bolts. The crux is moving over the second bolt. Worth doing if you are at Gallows edge.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt chained anchor.
content.location: This is the southernmost route that is located on the shelf above Gallow's Edge proper and is east facing so it gets early morning sun. There is an obvious cut off to the left when approaching Gallow's Edge. Follow this across minor talus for about 100 feet off of the main approach trail.

content.description:
The crack immediately right of Quality Control Be Damned is a decent beginner trad lead, with ample opportunities for placing pro from good stemming stances.  Start with the crack on either side of the block at the beginning.  Good stemming and fun climbing in the middle.  The crux is at a steeper section at the top with big holds.  There was some rubble and looseness on this line, we cleaned some of it off, but it's still nothing close to immaculate. 

  If this type of 5.4-5.7 shorty trad climbs interests you, there are a few lines similar to this that can be found on the Upper Ledge of Gallows, just find a good one and go for it.
content.protection: 1 set nuts and cams to 3".  Save some gear to build an anchor at the top, or use a static line to tie off a tree 30' back from the edge.

content.description: This is another thought provoking route for the grade. The crux is over the first bolt. There is an optional 1 inch gear placement between the second and third bolt if you are not comfortable with the minor run out. Gain a ledge over the third bolt to a blocky exit.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt chained anchor.
content.location: This route is located directly to the right of Dave And Crissa's Route. It starts on the same talus.

content.description:
Forgotten Crack is a forgettable splitter hand/fist crack in the Upper Gallows Edge region.  This climb is rated with lots of quality stars in both the online Gallows Edge guide and Jemez Rock, but taller and more sustained cracks can be found at the nearby ONP or BONP cliffs in my opinion.. 

  Start by stemming behind a block to the right, then follow splitter finger/hand crack up slab down low, then through a splitter hand crack crux up high, keeping an eye out for good footholds. 

  Soft for a 5.9 in White Rock, if you know how to hand jam.
content.protection: Nuts + 1 set cams up to 3", don't need real little ones.  Gotta build your own anchor at the top (static rope is helpful if you want to reach to a tree a ways back from the edge)
content.location: 2nd crack right of Quality Control... (after a low angle corner/chimney with the loose rock, wiseguy!). Start just left of the big block.

content.description: The small cliff above the Main Wall at Gallows Edge. Two bolted routes and a decent crack climb are found here.
